N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 201-1.15 - Requirement to commence construction

State Regulations

The existence of a valid permit shall not be construed as
authorizing construction if construction is not commenced within 18 months
after the date of permit issuance, if construction is discontinued for a period
of 18 months or more, or if construction is not completed within a reasonable
time as determined by the department. Up to an 18-month extension may be
granted by the department upon a showing of good cause in a written request by
the facility owner or operator. The department may suspend, modify or revoke
the permit or registration pursuant to Part 621 of this Title if construction
has not commenced within 18 months of issuance of such permit or registration, or construction has been discontinued f or a period of more than 18 months at
any point after issuance of such permit or registration. Notes
